div1.p: Hench thanks Cervantes for the "Medicas" reprint.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Enrique Cervantes, December 31, 1941
div1.opener:
Y. F.
December 31, 1941
Dr. Enrique Cervantes
Editor “America Clinica”
Inter-American Division
The New York Academy of Medicine
2 East 103rd Street
New York City
My dear Doctor Cervantes:
div1.p:
Thank you very kindly for sending me an issue of
“Medicas”. I appreciate this very much. I should be glad
to send you such reprints as I feel will be helpful to Latin
American doctors. I am sending you an article on gout. We
are finding much more gout than is suspected and have had some
gout patients from South America. As my supply of these re-
prints is very low, I would appreciate your returning this
reprint if you do not have definite use for it. I am also
sending you an abstract of a “new” disease we are just re-
porting.

Could you send me a dozen more copies of your article
if you have not already sent them to General Kean, General
Truby, Mr. Moran, Mr. Kissinger, and the others noted in the
painting?
div1.closer: Very truly yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
